revised_title: The Mechanism of Muscular Contraction: A Solid Film Theory
tldr: The author explores the mechanism of muscular contraction, suggesting that a solid film on the surface of muscle fibrils may be responsible for the variation of force exerted with the speed of shortening. The author also discusses the physical and chemical properties of muscle, including the role of anisotropic segments and molecular orientation in the contraction process.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Muscle Physiology
